texts.label: text
texts.orig: This Agreement is being made and entered into with reference to the following facts:
texts.text: This Agreement is being made and entered into with reference to the following facts:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1.1. Silicon Smelters and EIT both belong to the GROUP VILLAR MIR.
texts.text: 1.1. Silicon Smelters and EIT both belong to the GROUP VILLAR MIR.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1.2. The Customer is a company that manufactures ferro-alloys in both its factories: Polokwane and Rand Carbide.
texts.text: 1.2. The Customer is a company that manufactures ferro-alloys in both its factories: Polokwane and Rand Carbide.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1.3. EIT is a company that installs, integrates and develops the management and maintenance of Data Processing Systems, and desires to perform for the Customer the outsourcing services described in this Agreement.
texts.text: 1.3. EIT is a company that installs, integrates and develops the management and maintenance of Data Processing Systems, and desires to perform for the Customer the outsourcing services described in this Agreement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1.4. GROUP VILLAR MIR demands the Customer to use the management services of the group, developed and maintained by EIT, and subcontract the management of its IT infrastructure to EIT.
texts.text: 1.4. GROUP VILLAR MIR demands the Customer to use the management services of the group, developed and maintained by EIT, and subcontract the management of its IT infrastructure to EIT.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: EIT is in charge of the remote Network, which connects each workstation of the Customer to the Central Server of EIT and to Internet (hereinafter "WAN"). The internal network of the factories (hereinafter "LAN") is excluded from this Agreement and the Customer is responsible for it.
texts.text: EIT is in charge of the remote Network, which connects each workstation of the Customer to the Central Server of EIT and to Internet (hereinafter "WAN"). The internal network of the factories (hereinafter "LAN") is excluded from this Agreement and the Customer is responsible for it.

These services include the study, development and implementation of new applications, changing to new platforms, as well as any other service that the Customer may need in the field of IT services.
texts.text: 4.1. Apart from these services, EIT must provide other supplementary services, not considered in the present Agreement. These services include the study, development and implementation of new applications, changing to new platforms, as well as any other service that the Customer may need in the field of IT services.

texts.orig: 4.3. For that purpose and before the execution of the mentioned services by EIT, the Customer will pay EIT the package price, previously agreed by the parties. These services can either be carried out directly by EIT or by subcontracts in the sole discretion of EIT, which will have to notify the customer of this fact before the project commence. However if EIT decides to subcontract the project EIT remains responsible for the quality, the cost and the supervision of the services to the satisfaction of the customer.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: 5.3. If necessary, EIT personnel will travel, in prior agreement with the Customer, to the different factories of the company. In this case, the travelling expenses (travel, accommodation and meals) will be paid by the Customer.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5.4. The IT environment belongs to EIT during the total course of the Agreement, with exception of the services subcontracted to third parties by EIT, for which the subcontractor will be responsible.
texts.text: 5.4. The IT environment belongs to EIT during the total course of the Agreement, with exception of the services subcontracted to third parties by EIT, for which the subcontractor will be responsible.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5.5. EIT is responsible for the choice of the equipment considered the most appropriate in order to reach the service level convened in this Agreement. This equipment, and its further updates, should it arise, will be shown to the Customer and agreed upon prior to purchase and installation and refusal by the customer will only be valid upon presentation of a justification to EIT. EIT is responsible for the maintenance of its own IT environment, as well as of its maintenance and modernization expenses.

texts.text: 5.5.1. EIT STAFF

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 5.5.1.1. The work team appointed by EIT to fullfill this Agreement is responsible only to EIT, in accordance with the Spanish law. EIT will supervise and will be responsible for the behaviour and tasks of this team, especially on what concerns the confidentiality of the information.
texts.text: 5.5.1.1. The work team appointed by EIT to fullfill this Agreement is responsible only to EIT, in accordance with the Spanish law. EIT will supervise and will be responsible for the behaviour and tasks of this team, especially on what concerns the confidentiality of the information.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Customer does not have any responsibility for the accidents that might be suffered by the staff of EIT, or for the damages that might be caused by it to third parties, in the framework of its activities.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 5.5.2. SUBCONTRACTING
texts.text: 5.5.2. SUBCONTRACTING

texts.label: text
texts.orig: EIT assumes full responsibility for the execution of the tasks carried out by any subcontractor. The subcontractor is equally obliged to assure the service level, the confidentiality and the security convened in the Agreement, for the provision of these services. It is the responsibility of EIT to enter into an agreement with the subcontractor to ensure their performance.
texts.text: EIT assumes full responsibility for the execution of the tasks carried out by any subcontractor. The subcontractor is equally obliged to assure the service level, the confidentiality and the security convened in the Agreement, for the provision of these services. It is the responsibility of EIT to enter into an agreement with the subcontractor to ensure their performance.

texts.orig: 7.1. TOTAL ANNUAL AMOUNT
texts.text: 7.1. TOTAL ANNUAL AMOUNT

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The total annual amount to be paid, excluding taxes, for the year 2009, for the total provision of the services described in Article 2 of this Agreement, as well as the supervision of these (establishment of measurements and supervision meetings) will be:
texts.text: The total annual amount to be paid, excluding taxes, for the year 2009, for the total provision of the services described in Article 2 of this Agreement, as well as the supervision of these (establishment of measurements and supervision meetings) will be:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: TWO HUNDRED THOUSAND EUROS (200,000 €)
texts.text: TWO HUNDRED THOUSAND EUROS (200,000 €)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7.1.1. This amount has been fixed for the two factories of Silicon Smelters: Polokwane and Rand Carbide, being the annual amount per factory A HUNDRED THOUSAND EUROS (100,000 €).
texts.text: 7.1.1. This amount has been fixed for the two factories of Silicon Smelters: Polokwane and Rand Carbide, being the annual amount per factory A HUNDRED THOUSAND EUROS (100,000 €).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7.1.2. If one of the factories closes down, the total amount due will be reduced pro rata for the rest of the annual period for the factory's annual amount.
texts.text: 7.1.2. If one of the factories closes down, the total amount due will be reduced pro rata for the rest of the annual period for the factory's annual amount.

texts.text: 7.2.1. The invoicing of this amount will be carried out quarterly.

texts.orig: The invoices will be issued by EIT at the start of each term. Such invoice must be paid by the customer within 45 days of the date on which the invoice is issued.

The amount defined in Article 6.1 will be subjected to annual revision, following the publication of the Consumer Price Index in Spain (Spanish CPI) in January of each financial year by the National Statistics Institute of Spain. texts.text: 11.2. MANAGEMENT OF ACCESS RIGHTS

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 11.2.1. In accordance to Article 10.1, the Customer is in charge of defining the opening, closing or modifying of access to information. The Customer is also in charge of defining the user accesses, as well as the level of access of its users.
texts.text: 11.2.1. In accordance to Article 10.1, the Customer is in charge of defining the opening, closing or modifying of access to information. The Customer is also in charge of defining the user accesses, as well as the level of access of its users.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 11.2.2. 10.2.2. EIT guarantees the control of access (through an access code and password) to information pursuant to the access rights defined by the Customer.
texts.text: 11.2.2. 10.2.2. EIT guarantees the control of access (through an access code and password) to information pursuant to the access rights defined by the Customer.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 11.2.3. 10.2.3. EIT will not be held responsible if a Customer's user uses an access code and password of a third party.
texts.text: 11.2.3. 10.2.3. EIT will not be held responsible if a Customer's user uses an access code and password of a third party.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 12. SUPERVISION COMMISSION
texts.text: 12. SUPERVISION COMMISSION

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 12.1. The parties commit themselves to constitute a supervision commission formed by persons appointed for that purpose.
texts.text: 12.1. The parties commit themselves to constitute a supervision commission formed by persons appointed for that purpose.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 12.2. This commission will act as an intermediary between the parties and it will accomplish the following tasks:
texts.text: 12.2. This commission will act as an intermediary between the parties and it will accomplish the following tasks:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 12.2.1.1. Verify the fulfilment, in particular, the evolution and implementation, of all the services and applications. This operation will be recorded in the corresponding reports, according to the convened periodicity.
texts.text: 12.2.1.1. Verify the fulfilment, in particular, the evolution and implementation, of all the services and applications. This operation will be recorded in the corresponding reports, according to the convened periodicity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 12.2.1.2. Interpret any Article of this Agreement that might be questioned by the parties.
texts.text: 12.2.1.2. Interpret any Article of this Agreement that might be questioned by the parties.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 12.2.1.3. Resolve any potential conflict that may arise during the execution of this Agreement. For this, the commission members will act at their best, and assemble all the necessary information.
texts.text: 12.2.1.3. Resolve any potential conflict that may arise during the execution of this Agreement. For this, the commission members will act at their best, and assemble all the necessary information.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 12.3. If the commission members are not able to resolve a conflict or a problem in the interpretation of this Agreement within thirty natural days, the representatives of the parties will be duly informed in order to find a solution on friendly terms.
texts.text: 12.3. If the commission members are not able to resolve a conflict or a problem in the interpretation of this Agreement within thirty natural days, the representatives of the parties will be duly informed in order to find a solution on friendly terms.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13. DURATION
texts.text: 13. DURATION

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 13.1. The present Agreement is effective as from 1 January 2009. It is established by calendar year and renewed tacitly every year.
texts.text: 13.1. The present Agreement is effective as from 1 January 2009. It is established by calendar year and renewed tacitly every year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 13.2. The Agreement rests, for all that, cancellable at any time by any of the parties before the expiry date of the Agreement or any of its renewals, upon three months prior written notice.
texts.text: 13.2. The Agreement rests, for all that, cancellable at any time by any of the parties before the expiry date of the Agreement or any of its renewals, upon three months prior written notice.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 14. EARLY TERMINATION
texts.text: 14. EARLY TERMINATION

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 14.1. The Customer can cancel, on its own accord, the present Agreement upon certified notice to EIT, in the following cases:
texts.text: 14.1. The Customer can cancel, on its own accord, the present Agreement upon certified notice to EIT, in the following cases:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 14.1.1. If there is a repeated interruption, by EIT, of the services convened in this Agreement, for a period of four working days.
texts.text: 14.1.1. If there is a repeated interruption, by EIT, of the services convened in this Agreement, for a period of four working days.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 14.1.2. Upon the institution, by or against EIT, of insolvency, receivership or bankruptcy proceedings or any other proceedings for the settlement of its debts.
texts.text: 14.1.2. Upon the institution, by or against EIT, of insolvency, receivership or bankruptcy proceedings or any other proceedings for the settlement of its debts.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 14.1.3. Non-performance by EIT of its contractual obligations and warranties, assumed in the present Agreement.
texts.text: 14.1.3. Non-performance by EIT of its contractual obligations and warranties, assumed in the present Agreement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 14.1.4. Absorption or fusion of EIT by other companies. In this case, the Customer can decide if he wants to continue working with the new company, which will have to continue rendering all the services convened in this Agreement, in the same conditions.
texts.text: 14.1.4. Absorption or fusion of EIT by other companies. In this case, the Customer can decide if he wants to continue working with the new company, which will have to continue rendering all the services convened in this Agreement, in the same conditions.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 14.2. For simple convenience.
texts.text: 14.2. For simple convenience.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 14.2.1. In case the Customer cancels the Agreement in accordance with Articles 13.1, 13.2, EIT will pay the Customer the amount of 3.000 €, for the non observance of the Agreement of which it is responsible.
texts.text: 14.2.1. In case the Customer cancels the Agreement in accordance with Articles 13.1, 13.2, EIT will pay the Customer the amount of 3.000 €, for the non observance of the Agreement of which it is responsible.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 14.2.2. In case of termination of this Agreement by the Customer according to Article 13.5, the Customer will pay EIT the amount of 3.000 €.
texts.text: 14.2.2. In case of termination of this Agreement by the Customer according to Article 13.5, the Customer will pay EIT the amount of 3.000 €.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 15. CONTRACTUAL TRANSITION
texts.text: 15. CONTRACTUAL TRANSITION

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 15.1. In case of expiration or termination of the present Agreement, the Customer and EIT will cooperate, in good faith, to make possible a transfer, in due form to the Customer or to a third party, chosen by the Customer, for the provision of the services defined in this Agreement. For that purpose, the parties will develop, with enough time in advance and with the necessary haste, a Transition Plan where the actions and measures to be taken will be defined.
texts.text: 15.1. In case of expiration or termination of the present Agreement, the Customer and EIT will cooperate, in good faith, to make possible a transfer, in due form to the Customer or to a third party, chosen by the Customer, for the provision of the services defined in this Agreement. For that purpose, the parties will develop, with enough time in advance and with the necessary haste, a Transition Plan where the actions and measures to be taken will be defined.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 15.2. EIT will continue to provide the services defined in this Agreement between the date it receives from the Customer a notice of expiration or termination of this Agreement and the date this expiration or termination becomes effective.
texts.text: 15.2. EIT will continue to provide the services defined in this Agreement between the date it receives from the Customer a notice of expiration or termination of this Agreement and the date this expiration or termination becomes effective.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 15.3. EIT commits to hand over to the Customer, on this date, all the data and its copies, in the frame of the provision of services.
texts.text: 15.3. EIT commits to hand over to the Customer, on this date, all the data and its copies, in the frame of the provision of services.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 16. LITIGATION RULINGS
texts.text: 16. LITIGATION RULINGS

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 16.1. All the litigations that may arise between the parties during the period of application of the present Agreement, in relation with its Articles, and that have not been solved in a friendly manner, will be subjected to the rulings of their respective Chief Executives. In case of persistent disagreement, the litigation will be subjected to the General Management of Group Villar Mir.
texts.text: 16.1. All the litigations that may arise between the parties during the period of application of the present Agreement, in relation with its Articles, and that have not been solved in a friendly manner, will be subjected to the rulings of their respective Chief Executives. In case of persistent disagreement, the litigation will be subjected to the General Management of Group Villar Mir.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 16.2. However, if any of the parties no longer belongs to Group Villar Mir, any litigation that may not be solved in a friendly manner will be settled in compliance with the laws of Spain.
texts.text: 16.2. However, if any of the parties no longer belongs to Group Villar Mir, any litigation that may not be solved in a friendly manner will be settled in compliance with the laws of Spain.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 16.3. Any doubt that arises, in the frame of this Agreement, will be settled through arbitration in equity, in compliance with the Spanish Law of Arbitration, Ley 60/2003 , both parties agreeing to obey the decision. For the designation of the arbitrators and the management of the arbitration, the following rules will apply:
texts.text: 16.3. Any doubt that arises, in the frame of this Agreement, will be settled through arbitration in equity, in compliance with the Spanish Law of Arbitration, Ley 60/2003 , both parties agreeing to obey the decision. For the designation of the arbitrators and the management of the arbitration, the following rules will apply:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 16.3.1. There will be three arbitrators, solicitors. Each party will designate one, and these two will designate a third one.
texts.text: 16.3.1. There will be three arbitrators, solicitors. Each party will designate one, and these two will designate a third one.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 16.3.2. The place of arbitration will be Madrid.
texts.text: 16.3.2. The place of arbitration will be Madrid.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 16.3.3. It will be governed by the laws of Spain and the language of the process will be Spanish.
texts.text: 16.3.3. It will be governed by the laws of Spain and the language of the process will be Spanish.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 16.3.4. The arbitrators will dictate the decision within three months of the notice of the parties' acceptance.
texts.text: 16.3.4. The arbitrators will dictate the decision within three months of the notice of the parties' acceptance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 16.4. The parties, expressly waiving the Jurisdiction that may correspond to the same, submit themselves to the jurisdiction of the Courts and Tribunals of Madrid for any matter derived from the present Agreement that cannot be subjected to arbitration.
texts.text: 16.4. The parties, expressly waiving the Jurisdiction that may correspond to the same, submit themselves to the jurisdiction of the Courts and Tribunals of Madrid for any matter derived from the present Agreement that cannot be subjected to arbitration.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ANNEX 1: DEFINITIONS
texts.text: ANNEX 1: DEFINITIONS

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The following definitions apply in the present Agreement:
texts.text: The following definitions apply in the present Agreement:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: IT Department: Customer's work team in charge of the support and maintenance of the Customer's local infrastructure and applications.
texts.text: IT Department: Customer's work team in charge of the support and maintenance of the Customer's local infrastructure and applications.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: LAN: Internal network at the factories that connects the factory's routers with the workstations and peripheral devices of the site.
texts.text: LAN: Internal network at the factories that connects the factory's routers with the workstations and peripheral devices of the site.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: WAN: External network that connects the Silicon Smelter factories with the central node located in Madrid. Network leaving the router of each factory.
texts.text: WAN: External network that connects the Silicon Smelter factories with the central node located in Madrid. Network leaving the router of each factory.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: South African workdays : Monday to Friday, except for legal holidays of the South African work schedule.
texts.text: South African workdays : Monday to Friday, except for legal holidays of the South African work schedule.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: South African working hours : 8h00 - 20h00 during South African workdays.
texts.text: South African working hours : 8h00 - 20h00 during South African workdays.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Local Servers : Servers listed in Annex 3, which are located in the factories of Silicon Smelters.
texts.text: Local Servers : Servers listed in Annex 3, which are located in the factories of Silicon Smelters.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Central Servers : Servers listed in Annex 3, which are located outside the factories of Silicon Smelters.
texts.text: Central Servers : Servers listed in Annex 3, which are located outside the factories of Silicon Smelters.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Local Applications : IT applications used by Silicon Smelters and implemented on the local Servers. Silicon Smelters is responsible for these applications, which are listed in Annex 4.
texts.text: Local Applications : IT applications used by Silicon Smelters and implemented on the local Servers. Silicon Smelters is responsible for these applications, which are listed in Annex 4.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Data: The data or information belonging to the Customer saved on magnetic support or others, and that is subject to computer treatment.
texts.text: Data: The data or information belonging to the Customer saved on magnetic support or others, and that is subject to computer treatment.

table_cells.text: The Customer has contracted, taking into account the technological standards defined by EIT, an external company (hereinafter "Network Supplier") for the setting up and the management of the Network. This Network Supplier is accountable to the Customer for the management of the Network.
EIT commits itself to monitor the Network during working hours in South Africa, up to where the service rendered by the Network Supplier allows.

EIT commits itself to alert the IT Department of the Customer when any malfunction (power cut, saturation, etc.) is identified, and to carry out the necessary actions with the Network Supplier in order to solve this malfunction as quickly as possible.

EIT commits to assure a high availability (availability rate defined in Annex 2) and the proper performance (response time and no saturation) of the Network during working hours in South Africa (established in Annex 2).
The Customer and EIT commit themselves to give each other notice of any case of malfunction with the Network Supplier.

grid.text: The Customer has contracted, taking into account the technological standards defined by EIT, an external company (hereinafter "Network Supplier") for the setting up and the management of the Network. This Network Supplier is accountable to the Customer for the management of the Network.
EIT commits itself to monitor the Network during working hours in South Africa, up to where the service rendered by the Network Supplier allows.

EIT commits itself to alert the IT Department of the Customer when any malfunction (power cut, saturation, etc.) is identified, and to carry out the necessary actions with the Network Supplier in order to solve this malfunction as quickly as possible.

EIT commits to assure a high availability (availability rate defined in Annex 2) and the proper performance (response time and no saturation) of the Network during working hours in South Africa (established in Annex 2).
The Customer and EIT commit themselves to give each other notice of any case of malfunction with the Network Supplier.

table_cells.text: EIT is in charge of the list of servers (hereinafter "Servers") provided in Annex 3.
The Customer is responsible for the maintenance of the hardware of the local servers.
EIT is responsible for the maintenance of the hardware of the Central Server.
EIT commits to monitor the Servers during working hours in South Africa.
EIT must alert the IT Department of the Customer if any problem should occur in any of the Servers, within the time established in Annex 2.
EIT commits to solve any problems that may arise in the Servers, within the time established in Annex 2.
EIT is in charge of supervising and assuring the proper performance of the backups. For this, it has provided the Customer with a backup process.
The Customer commits to follow the backup process that EIT has provided for him.
The Customer must alert EIT of any incidence it might detect by sending an electronic mail to sistemas@eit.es.

grid.text: EIT is in charge of the list of servers (hereinafter "Servers") provided in Annex 3.

EIT is responsible for the maintenance of the hardware of the Central Server.
EIT commits to monitor the Servers during working hours in South Africa.
EIT must alert the IT Department of the Customer if any problem should occur in any of the Servers, within the time established in Annex 2.
EIT commits to solve any problems that may arise in the Servers, within the time established in Annex 2.
EIT is in charge of supervising and assuring the proper performance of the backups. For this, it has provided the Customer with a backup process.
The Customer commits to follow the backup process that EIT has provided for him.
The Customer must alert EIT of any incidence it might detect by sending an electronic mail to sistemas@eit.es.

table_cells.text: Monitor the applications to analyse the transaction charges and carry out the appropriate corrections in order to optimize the system.

Provide Level 2 assistance to users via direct telephone numbers of the persons responsible for each application, during the hours established in Annex 2. If there is a public holiday in Spain, EIT commits to provide for the Customer a central telephone number to communicate any incidences that may occur.
Solve the problems communicated by e-mail to incident.smelters@eit.es during working hours in South Africa, within time according to the severity of the problem, defined in Annex 2.
Maintain the present interfaces between the central application GES-INDUS and the Customer's local applications: Payroll Gesprod and Maximo.
Guarantee the reliability of the application (software and databases) and of the hardware support (server, disks, etc.), to prevent any loss of information that could affect the Customer's business.
Carry out the backups and necessary restorations in order to assure the durability of the application and prevent any loss of information.

Guarantee a high service level (reasonable response time and correct progress of transactions). With regard to the electronic mail service, EIT will be able, after contacting with the Customer, to restrict the type and size of exchanged files. It is noted that the customer currently do not make use of this service but has the option to use it at no additional cost

Assure the security of the access to information: the Customer is responsible for the opening of accesses to the applications. EIT commits to supply the necessary securities to ensure the access rights defined by the Customer guarantee access only to the data authorized by the Customer.

Solve the problems communicated by e-mail to incident.smelters@eit.es during working hours in South Africa, within time according to the severity of the problem, defined in Annex 2.

Assure the security of the access to information: the Customer is responsible for the opening of accesses to the applications. EIT commits to supply the necessary securities to ensure the access rights defined by the Customer guarantee access only to the data authorized by the Customer.

table_cells.text: The Annual Package Price does not include a protection to inflation. For this reason, the amount will be adjusted annually, according to the growth of the Spanish CPI as was indicated above.
The new payment is calculated using the following formula:  R  =  R 0 * ( S +1), where:
R0 is the payment corresponding to the previous year.
R is the new payment, and
S is the last Spanish CPI published on the revision date.

As a result, once the first year, since the date the Agreement was executed, has passed, and on this same date on the following years, the annual price will be modified in proportion with the growth of the Spanish CPI.

In case that the National Statistics Institute of Spain does not publish the CPI or it be significantly modified in form and content, the parties will agree to a new equivalent measurement, which must be published at least annually.

grid.text: The Annual Package Price does not include a protection to inflation. For this reason, the amount will be adjusted annually, according to the growth of the Spanish CPI as was indicated above.

R is the new payment, and

As a result, once the first year, since the date the Agreement was executed, has passed, and on this same date on the following years, the annual price will be modified in proportion with the growth of the Spanish CPI.

In case that the National Statistics Institute of Spain does not publish the CPI or it be significantly modified in form and content, the parties will agree to a new equivalent measurement, which must be published at least annually.

table_cells.text: EIT commits to maintain its IT environment in accordance to the technological advances, in order to prevent it from becoming obsolete.

EIT guarantees that the services described in this Agreement will be rendered in accordance with the best practice, a quality level accepted by the Customer, and in accordance with the service levels defined in Annex 2.

The IT staff of EIT will carry out the exploitation of the services during working hours in South Africa, except for urgent actions that will be carried out exceptionally, if it were necessary, out of the established hours.
EIT will produce a daily backup copy of the data and the applications residing in its IT environment, in order to re- establish and retrieve lost information.
EIT is responsible for any damages caused to the Customer or to third parties, when these result from EIT not satisfying the contractual obligations.

Nevertheless, EIT will be free of responsibility, in case of not satisfying its obligations, if he can prove that this was due to force majeure or external causes out of his control, like accidents, natural disasters, vandalism acts or theft.
The liability of EIT will be limited to a value equal to contractual value as per clause 7.1 and will not exceed this value.

table_cells.text: Confidential Information means any information disclosed by either party in the frame of this Agreement. In consequence, each party agrees not to use, disclose, publish or disseminate any Confidential Information of the other party for any purpose except to perform its obligations or exercise its rights under this Agreement, except:
Following prior consent of the other party, or
If the information was in the public domain at the time it was disclosed or becomes in the public domain through no act or omission of the Receiving Party.
Any of these exceptions will not be presumed in any case, and the revealing party must clear any doubt to this respect.

Both parties shall take reasonable precautions to preserve in strict confidence any confidential or proprietary information obtained by them, their agents, employees, subcontractors, suppliers, consultants, and in general, any person that has access to it.

Confidential Information includes any technical, economic, financial and/or commercial information, confidential or not, bearing in any commercial relationship and in general, without any limitation, any information to which any of the parties has access during the application, in the frame of this Agreement.

Except as provided hereinafter, for a period of five years after termination or expiration of this Agreement, each party shall not disclose, publish or disseminate information received from the other party which may be required to carry out this Agreement and which the disclosing party deems proprietary and confidential.

Once this Agreement has expired, each party must, depending on the choice of the other party, destroy or hand over all technical, economic, financial or commercial information, confidential or not, in its possession, directly or indirectly, as convened in the present Agreement.

grid.text: Confidential Information means any information disclosed by either party in the frame of this Agreement. In consequence, each party agrees not to use, disclose, publish or disseminate any Confidential Information of the other party for any purpose except to perform its obligations or exercise its rights under this Agreement, except:

Confidential Information means any information disclosed by either party in the frame of this Agreement. In consequence, each party agrees not to use, disclose, publish or disseminate any Confidential Information of the other party for any purpose except to perform its obligations or exercise its rights under this Agreement, except:
Following prior consent of the other party, or
If the information was in the public domain at the time it was disclosed or becomes in the public domain through no act or omission of the Receiving Party.
Any of these exceptions will not be presumed in any case, and the revealing party must clear any doubt to this respect.
Any of these exceptions will not be presumed in any case, and the revealing party must clear any doubt to this respect.

Both parties shall take reasonable precautions to preserve in strict confidence any confidential or proprietary information obtained by them, their agents, employees, subcontractors, suppliers, consultants, and in general, any person that has access to it.
